comments.commentBody: Within days 30-40% Americans will believe this made up lie is true because Trump said it.
Already there.
The guilty mind sweats paranoia.

Just when you thought Trump's staff had finally reined him in so he'd quit embarrassing himself and our country, here comes another salvo from the 10 year old. Trump is incapable of admitting flaws or mistakes. He shifts the blame wherever he can so he doesn't look guilty. Most of us grow out of that behavior by the time we're 15, but apparently not this guy.
To think that such an immature man has his finger on the nuclear button is terrifying.

Any discussion of Trump 'pivoting' or becoming 'presidential' after his speech to Congress is over. This man is not presidential, and never will be. Find the Russian smoking gun, dust it for little fingerprints and then publish it. Let's get rid of this guy.

Mr. Trump’s absurd accusation hurled at his predecessor only reinforces what we already knew.  He is temperamentally unfit for the most consequential office on the planet; constantly seeks to deflect his problems instead of addressing them; is incapable of meeting the varied demands of the job, and he’s probably off his rocker.  Mr. Trump; we, the concerned public, have been through Watergate, Iran-Contra, a rabid impeachment, the 9-11 attack, and an unnecessary war.  We are the toughest opponent you will ever face. And we will not be distracted from learning the entire truth about your nefarious dealings and Russian connections.

Thought provoking. 350 million to one.
Cut in half for his supporters just to be fair
175 million to one. Don't seem like good odds...
And release those tax returns!!
Trump, offering no evidence, equals trump lying---again!

Actually the evidence is the FISA approval, on the record. Please inform yourself.

This place is the definition of the Left Wing Echo Chameber.
If you can show that an Obama wiretap of Trump's phone in Trump Tower was approved, you have the scoop of the century! Please show your evidence.

J

Not that saywhat neglected the point but one wonders why you don't simply prove your assertion true? That is what is so despicable about right wing extremists like you. You come on here and try to call people out using lies. and you know you are lying. That is why you don't respond.

(Doodle-doodle doodle-doodle) Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to the Twilight Zone.  Trump's paranoia has taken on a life of its own and will continue to dominate news about his presidency.  Better for us to see it now than later.  Let the impeachment proceedings begin.
This is simply another Trump red herring to draw the focus off of the Russia issue, and once again, the media eats it up.

I'm constantly dumbfounded by how stupid America has become. It's unconscionable that a sitting president is allowed to lie and lie and lie with no repercussions from anyone. Luftwaffe head Hermann Goering once remarked that constant lies make people believe them. So true here in nitwit America.
Yes sir.  This country seems to house a good portion of some of the most idiotic people walking the face of the earth.  Just so embarrassing.
Remember that we allowed GW Bush to do his thing.......hard to beat that for being stupid Americans. this is just more of the same from the very same people who drive this.
The Nazi period in history is sometimes described as when an entire nation went insane.  Here in American we are at least halfway there.
How could such a monstrous fool have been elected President?
@ proffexpert:  Your question:  "How could such a monstrous fool have been elected President?"  The answer:  By a lot of other monstrous fools.
Same way that GW Bush was elected.

What would
» "take responsibility for
» the messes Trump will create"
involve?

UNstart wars?

UNcrash the economy?

Bring back people improperly deported, and restore their jobs and families?

Resurrect, heal and compensate the victims of hate crimes he enables?

Suck the coal sludge from the rivers, the lead from people's bloodstreams, the algae blooms from warming (and acidifying) oceans, "his" excess aliquots of CO2 and CH3 from the atmosphere, the untested toxins from the pharmacopeia?

We're fighting entropy. "Success" can only occur in discrete, minority locations. It would require expenditures much larger than the cost of leaving things unbroken in the first place.

The power to destroy always exceeds the power to create. Or repair.

Every day that Trump is in office, the world is screwed up more. Irreparably.

On top of that, the first three people in the order of succession (Pence, Ryan, Hatch) don't represent much improvement in the integrity department. Tillerson, the fourth, is an unknown quantity, and Mnuchin is a vulture. You have to go 6 people down to reach a respectable brain (Mattis), and after him comes Jefferson Beauregard Sessions the Third.

We're screwed.

Not even the President of the United States can order a wiretap of phones.

If Trump’s phone was tapped (now it seems quite certain it was, because Trump said so, and he never lies), then there must have been a court order. And that court order must have been based on a reasonable suspicion of wrongdoing. And it happened in October.

So, what reasonable suspicion of wrongdoing might have been raised in October, regarding Trump? You guessed it: Russian hacking of the election. Which in turn implies that the warrant was issued by the super-secret FISA court (well-known to almost never refuse a warrant request.)

And that means that the either the FBI, or the CIA, or the NSA, knows a lot about what was really going on. And Trump knows they know, because this morning, he was briefed. He's screwed and he knows it.
Aha!  A court order!  Well, we know about that craven judiciary...
Impeccable logic. I hope logic is still real.
It is a sword that Bannon has prepared for him. We shall get Pence before 2017 is out. Hopefully, the electorate will be awake in 2018.

Unbecoming a President to make accusations such as this with no proof offered. I guess we're back to the "not born in the USA" ruse. People believe these outlandish lies without question and then, when political expediency arrives, the perpetrator denies the lie without any ownership at all. Shame on the President and shame on those who believe this tripe! Nothing more than a smokescreen for the real issue: administration ties to Russia.

These words say it all:

"No president can order a wiretap.” "Those restrictions were put in place to protect citizens from people like you.”

Great! But when is our seditious Congress going to step up and protect this nation - and it's reputation - from our deluded, fantasy driven Liar-In-Chief?

"Calvin and Hobbes" was a look into the imagination fueled, zany world of a six year old, self-centered wild child. How is it that 30 years later, it's become a roadmap on how to find a saner, more mature model of our President and Commander-In-Chief? Add to this, the growing, substantial pile of evidence indicating that Trump is functionally illiterate - which is why he will not do many briefings - and we have what amounts to a critical, ongoing national emergency.

Make that a world emergency... The man has his finger on the nation's nuclear trigger, and is ultimate Commander of the world's largest military. What happens if he decides to distract everyone from Russia by nuking North Korea? Why is it OK that this continue?
Yes and he believes Breitbart and Faux News because the intelligence agencies like the NSA, CIA and FBI are all liars.
There you go- giving das toddler's tantrum a platform and disseminating the lies 42-44% believe to be true. Taking the bait every time, it's going to be a long 4 years.
He's also laying the groundwork to make excuses to his supporters for when he has to resign.
It appears the presidential stress on Trump is driving him over the edge.  Hope the GOP keeps him under strict surveillance.  He's their responsibility.
Let's keep up the pressure!
Particularly after Midnight early Saturday mornings.

Please stop this made man journalists!! This clown is mentally unhinged and needs to be impeached. Let's hope our nation can endure this fool and his minions till congress gets a spine and sends him packing.

I hope mainstream media will not allow The Donald to shift focus from his gang's Russian ties to outlandish accusations against President Obama.  On the other hand, it's about time The Donald was sued for slander.  Or is it libel if the vitriol is tweeted?  In any case the outright lies are bad enough; character assassination is something else again.
Don't worry -- the media can focus on more than one thing at a time -- they've been doing a pretty good job of it lately.

Funny thing is Trump has said for months that he would like looser libel laws so he can go after his detractors and accusers. Someone one with a cooler head advised against such an idea on the grounds that more likely that, it would be easier for others to sue Trump himself.
Surely the aliens can't be far behind Obama.  I understand they target orange-haired people but, if his head is wrapped in aluminum foil, they can't make contact.

I watched the movie Arrival the other night and loved it, but I thought they could have done a better job at presenting what an Alien creature might look like. It seemed odd to me that an alien would look like an octopus.

Can you imagine what an alien civilization would think if they landed on Earth and were greeted by Trump with his orange hair blowing in the wind. I think they would have a similar reaction.

Bizarre.
Unhinged.
Reckless.
We are at a certain national security crisis point if this is how the current 'administration' (using the word loosely) is going to continue to conduct itself.
The LAST two paragraphs of this piece are especially important. Along with the middle section about his pre-occupation with taping.
Bizarre.
Unhinged.
Reckless.
Dangerous.

This is a pathetic attempt to move the focus of the discussion away from where it ought to remain: on Trump and his campaign's collusion with the Russians to help sway the election.  Think what you may about Obama and the job he did as a President (I think he was excellent), his reputation is stirling and won't be tarnished by the small and insecure man that Trump is.  That he tweeted all this once again from West Palm Beach, knowing that millions more of our tax dollars are being wasted, shouldn't be lost on us.

By one estimate he and his family have already cost taxpayers $97 million.

"By one sketchy estimate, Trump and his family, in their security and travel demands, have already rung up as much in accounts payable by taxpayers as the Obama and Biden families did in eight years, a figure elsewhere calculated, by the Washington DC-based Judicial Watch, as topping $97m."
Read more details: https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2017/mar/04/donald-trump-travel-cost...

I recall him stating that he would work late into the night and weekends if necessary to do his job. He is now on his fourth golf weekend during the six weeks he has been in office. He made that statement after slamming Obama for the occasional golf holiday. The man has no shame.
It looks like you are not a professional translator and by definition, a translation loses part of the original text.

When Kim Jong-un in his New Year address announced that his country has built – and is prepared to test – an intercontinental ballistic missile capable of carrying nuclear warheads, Trump jumped to Twitter and responded: "It won't happen."
Obviously Trump has underestimated the threat that North Korea poses to the US. During the campaign he thought he could outsource the problem to China and simply ignored Pyongyang's nuclear programme. He seems to have no clue what to do. A strategy that makes sense would be to cooperate with China, which is North Korea's old ally.

Don't underestimate Trump. Others have made that mistake, and where are they now? Just whining and trying to undermine his administration, but aside from being disruptive and annoying, accomplishing nothing...

Indeed the writer was "captured" by Carrere into making him one of the best French writers of nonfiction. My opinion is based on the reading of The Kingdom, which I found to be one of the most artificial and arrogant books I have read. He makes himself the hero of the story by putting himself at the same of Christ, Saint Paul and Saint Luke and spending more than half of the book on himself, describing absolutely irrelevant aspects of his life, like the search for a nanny in Paris and the writing of his (obscure) book on Phillip K. Dick. He did very little research on the birth of Christianity, basing most of his opinions on a relatively unknown, salacious, book on Christianity written 19th century. He is so arrogant as to tell us what was Saint Luke thinking and why the Magnificat is an invention and so offensive as to claim that the Virgin Mary masturbated herself. How does he know? Any evidence, even indirect? His evidence seems to come from his admitted love of masturbating while watching pornographic movies.
It is not that he "reinvented nonfiction.....”, "blends personal history, reportage, philosophy and theology" as the author says, but that he produces a hodge-podge of anything that comes to his mind. It is an insult to the reader’s intelligence. I doubt that the author of the article read Carrere’s books. If you can read Spanish or Italian, see my extensive review of El Reino in Amazon.com and Il Regno in Amazon.it

"Lives other than my own" is a masterpiece. The way Carrère talks about his inability to be at peace with himself, to find happiness is both heart wrenching and funny. Later, he is taught about love and altruism by the very people he chooses to write about and his characters stay with you for ever.
I so admire how he can take you into people's lives and talk to you about them with such respect, admiration and tenderness in part because their ability to live, to work, to love is foreign to him.
I have given away this gem of a book many many times, very much like I gave away Joan Didion's "The Year of magical thinking"
Enjoy! you are in for a real treat.
